credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Project of a twisted column
provenance: From the collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
medium:
Pen and brown ink with gray wash, white heightening and traces of graphite
Support: off-white laid paper
description: Below in a 1/3 and 2/3 height calyces of small upright leaves are running around the column.  A garland of leaves and blossoms of roses is following the hallows.  Below the plan.  On the reverse part of two architectural designs: a closing wall or attic and below a plan.
name: Drawing
